name: shortsightedness
content:
shortsightedness noun [U]
(THOUGHT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of not thinking enough about how an action will affect the future, or an example of this: The shortsightedness of these policies can be seen today in Congress. The hypocrisy and short-sightedness of this decision is immense. Opposites
far-sightedness (JUDGMENT)
long-sightedness (JUDGMENT)
More examplesFewer examplesHe proved himself to be a poor judge of character, blinded by political short-sightedness.The selfishness and short-sightedness of modern society is seen in litter-strewn, graffiti-vandalized communities.

shortsightedness noun [U]
(SIGHT)
mainly UK (US usually nearsightedness) the condition of only being able to see clearly objects that are close to you: In spite of his asthma and shortsightedness, he was a competent player. The lenses have mainly been tested on people with moderate short-sightedness. Synonym
myopiaOpposite
long-sightedness (EYES) mainly UK
More examplesFewer examplesTo measure long or shortsightedness, a narrow beam of light is shone into the eye.She goes into hospital on Monday for laser surgery to correct her shortsightedness.
